title: Nationals head to franchise's 1st World Series Video
text:
Transcript for Nationals head to franchise's 1st World Series

The Washington nationals, here they are. They are world series bound for the first time in franchise history. They swept the St. Louis cardinals out of the playoffs last night. Washington jumping off to a 7-0 lead in the first inning against the cardinals and they never looked back, winning the game 7-4 and they might have "Baby shark" to thank for their run because the team got hot when outfielder parabegan using the viral kids' song as his walk-up music back in June when he would come up to bat. He got two hits that game and he has been exciting ever since. The fans and teammates all jump you see them wearing those -- dressed in shark costumes at the ballpark last night and the Washington nationals, they will face the Yankees or the Astros in the world series and whoever gave us this hat, this is the dustiest hat I have ever seen. It's been a long time since Washington made it -- Yeah, okay. Whoo! Very happy for all those

This transcript has been automatically generated and may not be 100% accurate.
description: The Washington Nationals defeated the St. Louis Cardinals 7 -4 Tuesday night to notch their first-ever National League title.
